TopicTitle: Poll: Kerbal Space Program's Mun Landers

Articles.Content:
I pulled landings and lifts from Mun, minmus, ike and duna. I am still desperate to pull off a apollo mission tho. I just never get those things to land in shape to relaunch.

alacrity

On my first attempt, second time I travel to the Mun and third day of playing this game. I made it to the Mun and back again using my Orbiter II, the second rocket I got out into orbit, in career mode. I still can't believe I made it. When I entered the atmosphere of Kerbol there was about 10 seconds worth of fuel left.

The thought that stroked me most reading through this thread was "Wait, there is a quick save button?". Alright, I know, I know. Traveling to the Mun and back again successfully in one go on the first ever attempt isn't really that impressive. But for me, it was one hell of a ride. When I had landed on the moon (I tipped over, but managed to save the situation) the amount of fuel left for the return was scary low.

Lunar Lander I mounted on the Orbiter II

On the Mun

And back again safely

That's the Universe Replacer mod, I think. Or something like it.

I thought so. I keep meaning to install that one, but always get sidetracked.
I can and I've done so numerous times, including Apollo style, but I won't participate in the poll because I'm not going to open KSP now to take screenshots proving it.

Not exactly a text book landing, but Jeb didn't seem too bothered

An example of an actually successful landing, in a similar lander

file:///Users/admin2/Desktop/screenshot14.png

Here...

Here munlanding on real Kerbin.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

How about video proof, from career mode?

Munar Touch-down is at 21:23.

Kerbin re-entry begins at 28:50.

In my Career Mode Let's Play Episode 5, I land on Minmus and return as well. (

)
Back when the South Pole Crater's monolith was on the ground.

Here's a picture of my most recent landing.

Landing on the Mun isn't that difficult once you have figured out the basics - what I'm still struggling with is how to get a decent payload onto the surface without landing completely unrealistic huge objects. So far, the best I can do is about 5 tons of Payload with a moderate-sized lander (as seen above).

Throw Minmus in the mix also:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I think I just about managed to build a rocket that can do it.... 100% stock parts too.

I remember how hard it was when I first started playing though, it's a great feeling the first time you do it! Now I can get there without thinking.
Eventually the Mun just becomes a site where you can test your interplanetary designs, or whip up a couple of quick science points to unlock that one checkpoint you need.

OK, managed my first landing on the Mun last night. Got out, planted a flag, got back into the lander.

But... Oh noes! Not enough fuel to make lunar orbit. So I rotated and splashed Kerbal DNA over the munar landscape.

I love all of the awesome ideas! Great source for inspiration.

Edited February 2, 2014 by NACH0 TAC0

Jeb mining on the Mun.

He looks like he's seen a... a.... it's full of stars!

Allow me to just point say something to everyone. Don't worry if you can't return from a Mun landing. It took me some time before I could do it, a whole year as a matter of fact. And that's including mods, took a further half-year to do so with stock parts.

Still think it's bad that you can't do it? OK, I had landed on Moho before I could return from the Mun. There you go, now if you can do that you can return from the mun. Really, it takes far less Delta V to go to the Mun and return than it does to go to Moho.

On with the proof that I can do it:

NOTE: Lost the screenshots when I updated the game. I'll do another mission (as I planned to soon, anyway) and post the images then.
So I clicked yes, and what are you going to do about it if I don't post pics

Well, i guess i will now share an album of my oldest Mun landings, oh the memories.

These are pics of my oldest Mun landings, including all of my landings would be quite a feat!

I tried to do it with the lightest command podded ship I could. Not great by the standards shown by the good players around here, but pretty minimal I feel.

Riding the command pod down like a boss...or like an idiot, not sure which!

I think the majority of players have, including myself. I'll include a link to my Steam profile, if a proof is so important...

I take all yalls landings and up you a base.
